action.action-desc: Ms. Letlow (for herself, Ms. Tokuda, Mr. Kiley of California, Mr. Case, and Mr. Ciscomani) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To modify the program of grants to support high-quality charter schools.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Empower Charter School Educators to Lead Act.

section.header: Grants to support high-quality charter schools
section.text: Section 4303 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7221b) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)(C), by striking and after the semicolon; and
by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the following:
provide technical assistance to eligible applicants and authorized public chartering agencies in carrying out the activities described in paragraph (1);
work with authorized public chartering agencies in the State to improve authorizing quality, including developing capacity for, and conducting, fiscal oversight and auditing of charter schools; and

clause.text: fund a revolving loan fund or similar mechanisms for expenses under subsection (h) prior to an eligible applicant receiving reimbursement; and
provide assistance to eligible applicants in locating and accessing a facility; and

paragraph.text: provide pre-charter planning subgrants (in amounts of no more than $100,000 per prospective applicant) to charter school developers that—

clause.text: to an authorized public chartering agency to operate a charter school; or
to nonprofit or public entities for the provision of financial support to such developers;
have not less than 54 months of school-based experience (which may include experience in teaching in or administering after school or summer school programs); and
have demonstrated leadership competencies and success with students, as determined by the State entity; and

subparagraph.text: have successfully completed the development of an initial plan for opening a charter school, as evidenced by a description of the educational needs of the community in which the proposed charter school will be located and how the proposed charter school will be suited to meet those needs.
in subparagraph (A), by striking 90 percent and inserting 80 percent;

clause.text: by striking not less than 7 percent and inserting not more than 10 percent; and
by striking and after the semicolon;

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (D), as so redesignated, by striking 3 percent and inserting 5 percent; and
by inserting after subparagraph (B) the following:
reserve not more than 5 percent of such funds to carry out the activities described in subsection (b)(3); and

paragraph.text: in subsection (d)(1)(B), by striking this section and inserting subsection (b)(1);
in subsection (e)(2), by striking this section and inserting subsection (b)(1);

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding subclause (I), by inserting under subsection (b)(1) after program; and
in subclause (II), by striking subgrant funds under this section and inserting subgrant funds under subsection (b)(1); and

paragraph.text: in subsection (h), in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking this section and inserting subsection (b)(1).
